t: I*p exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks, be made for all men;
For*p kings, and for all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.
For*p this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour;
Who*p will have all men to be saved, and to come unto the knowledge of the truth.
For*p there is one God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus;
Who*p gave himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time.
Whereunto*p I am ordained a preacher, and an apostle, (I speak the truth in Christ, and lie not;) a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity.
I*p will therefore that men pray every where, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting.
In*p like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with shamefacedness and sobriety; not with broided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;
But*p (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.
Let*p the woman learn in silence with all subjection.
But*p I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence.
For*p Adam was first formed, then Eve.
And*p Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.
Notwithstanding*p she shall be saved in childbearing, if they continue in faith and charity and holiness with sobriety.
